title: Makj
text:
Mackenzie Johnson, better known by his <a href="stage%20name">stage name</a> Makj (stylized as MAKJ), is an American <a href="Disc%20jockey">DJ</a> and <a href="Record%20producer">music producer</a>. He has released a number of singles as a solo artist since 2012, as well as a large number of collaborative singles with artists such as <a href="Hardwell">Hardwell</a>, <a href="Lil%27%20Jon">Lil' Jon</a>, and M35. Since 2013 Makj has performed at large festivals such as <a href="Electric%20Zoo%20Festival">Electric Zoo</a>, <a href="Voodoo%20Experience">Voodoo Experience</a>, <a href="Coachella%20Festival%20line-ups">Coachella</a>, and a main stage slot at <a href="TomorrowWorld">TomorrowWorld</a>. In March 2014, "<a href="Billboard%20%28magazine%29">Billboard</a>" named him one of the Top 10 Artists to Watch at <a href="Ultra%20Music%20Festival">Ultra Music Festival</a>. Also in 2014 he was named No. 63 in the Top 100 DJs list put out by the <a href="DJ%20Magazine">"DJ Magazine" Awards</a>. Makj is the host of the radio show "Revolution Radio" on <a href="Clear%20Channel%20Communications">Clear Channel</a>’s "Evolution" channel.
Biography.
Mackenzie Johnson was born in 1990 in <a href="San%20Luis%20Obispo%2C%20California">San Luis Obispo, California</a>. By his teens, he was living in <a href="China">China</a> while pursuing a career as a professional race car driver. At age fifteen, he became interested in DJing, and he purchased a set of <a href="Technics%20%28brand%29">Technics 1200 Turntables</a>. By age 17, he had returned to the United States, where he found himself invited to perform at local events in his hometown. He had a number of lessons with <a href="DJ%20AM">DJ AM</a>, who trained Makj on <a href="scratching">scratching</a>.
In late 2013, Makj embarked on his first major US tour, traveling the country with <a href="Bingo%20Players">Bingo Players</a> and <a href="Bassjackers">Bassjackers</a>. After a time playing small venues, he began to attend festivals as well. Since 2013, he has performed at festivals such as <a href="Electric%20Zoo%20Festival">Electric Zoo Festival</a>, <a href="Voodoo%20Experience">Voodoo Experience</a>, <a href="Coachella%20Festival%20line-ups">Coachella</a>, a main stage slot at <a href="TomorrowWorld">TomorrowWorld</a>, Northern Lights Festival, <a href="Euphoria%20Festival">Euphoria Festival</a>, <a href="Webster%20Hall">Webster Hall</a>, and <a href="Ruby%20Skye">Ruby Skye</a>. In March 2014, "<a href="Billboard%20%28magazine%29">Billboard</a>" named him one of the Top 10 Artists to Watch at <a href="Ultra%20Music%20Festival">Ultra Music Festival</a>. He toured Europe in 2014 with his "Let’s Get Fucked Up Tour," then traveled North America with his "Peyote Tour." Plans for an Asian tour were also announced.
He has released a number of singles as a solo artist since 2012, as well as a large number of collaborative singles. He has collaborated with artists such as <a href="Showtek">Showtek</a>, <a href="Lil%20Jon">Lil Jon</a>, and <a href="DJ%20Kura">DJ Kura</a>. In 2013, he released a collaborative single with <a href="Hardwell">Hardwell</a> entitled "Countdown" which peaked at No. 1 on Beatport within three days. He has also released music on Hysteria Records, Doorn Records, Diffused Records, and <a href="Juicy%20Music">Juicy Music</a>, among others. In late 2014, he released his track "Generic," which had earlier debuted at the Ultra Festival in <a href="Miami">Miami</a>. Several of his original songs have charted in the Beatport Top 10.
Makj has been a guest judge for the <a href="Campus%20DJ">Campus DJ</a> contest, and he is the host of a radio show on <a href="Clear%20Channel%20Communications">Clear Channel</a>’s "Evolution" channel, with the show also streaming at <a href="iHeartRadio">iHeartRadio</a> and <a href="101.7">101.7</a> Boston.
